parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

context.name: Peering
context.description: This level is used to view, add, set, and delete peer entries.

context.name: Peers
context.description: This level is used to view, add, set, and delete a peer.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the peer-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a peer.

parameter.name: hostName
parameter.description: The name of the host.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: The IP address, host, or domain name.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify peer-related attributes.

parameter.name: hostName
parameter.description: The name of the host.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: The IP address, host, or domain name.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing peer.

parameter.name: hostName
parameter.description: The name of the host to be deleted.

context.name: ProfileTuning
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the profile tuning for the server.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the general settings of profile tuning.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to get the last applied profile tuning name.

command.name: apply
command.description: This command is used to apply a specific tuning profile. The printed output lists the difference between the current values stored within the configuration and the new values that will be set by applying the profile.

parameter.name: profileTuningName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the selected profile tuning.

command.name: describe
command.description: This command is used to print the configuration changes performed by a profile. The printed output lists the difference between the current values stored within the configuration and the new values that would be set by applying the profile. No configuration changes are applied.

parameter.name: profileTuningName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the selected profile tuning.

context.name: Resources
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the physical resources of the server.

context.name: Memory
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the memory allocation rules for the applications running on the server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to show memory allocation general settings. They include the over-allocation protection, which will adjust the container memory allocation if the configured memory settings exceed physical memory available.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to set memory allocation general settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: overAllocationProtection
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether the software manager adjusts the containers memory allocation if the configured memory settings exceed the physical memory available. The default value is "true".

context.name: Containers
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the memory allocation rules for each container.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display container memory allocation settings and runtime values.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the memory allocation settings for a container. For the purpose of the set command, the memory can be expressed as an amount of memory (in megs) or a percentage of physical memory. Modifying one of the values causes the other to be recalculated.

parameter.name: containerName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the container name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: amount
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of memory that is allocated to a container (in megs).

parameter.name: percentage
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the percentage of physical memory that is allocated to a container.

context.name: Security
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Access Control List (ACL) security options for the server.

context.name: BlackList
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Access Control List (ACL) black list security options for the BroadWorks server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display network security-related attributes. It displays the Access Control List (ACL) black list that filters inbound network packets to the BroadWorks server. Packets that match entries in the black list are processed by the BroadWorks server.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an entry to the Access Control List (ACL) black list.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceIp/sourceMask pair as a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp is always the string representation of the IP whether IPv4 or IPv6.

parameter.name: Mask
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the source mask. It is in dotted string format for IPv4 (for example, 255.255.0.0) or the number of bits in the mask for IPv4 and IPv6.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination IP address of the packet matches against this IP address. This is one of the configured IP addresses of the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: destinationPortFirst
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the first port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: destinationPortLast
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the last port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter determines the received network packet matches against this protocol. Values include" "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove an entry from the Access Control List (ACL) black list.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceIp/sourceMask pair as a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp/sourceMask pair defines a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp is always the string representation of the IP whether IPv4 or IPv6.

parameter.name: Mask
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceMask is in dotted string for IPv4 (for example, 255.255.0.0) or the number of bits in the mask for IPv4 and IPv6.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination IP address of the packet matches against this IP address. This is one of the configured IP addresses of the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: destinationPortFirst
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the first port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: destinationPortLast
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the last port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter determines the received network packet matches against this protocol. Values include: "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

context.name: WhiteList
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Access Control List (ACL) white list security options for the BroadWorks server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display the network security-related attributes. It displays the Access Control List white list that filters inbound network packets to the BroadWorks Server. Packets match entries in the white list to be processed by the BroadWorks server.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an entry to the Access Control List ( ACL) white list.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceIp/sourceMask pair as a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp is always the string representation of the IP whether IPv4 or IPv6.

parameter.name: Mask
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceMask is in dotted string for IPv4 (for example, 255.255.0.0) or the number of bits in the mask for IPv4 and IPv6.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination IP address of the packet matches against this IP address. This is one of the configured IP addresses of the BroadWorks Server.

parameter.name: destinationPortFirst
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the first port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: destinationPortLast
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the last port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter determines the received network packet matches against this protocol. Values include: "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove an entry from the Access Control List (ACL) white list.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceIp/sourceMask pair as a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp/sourceMask pair defines a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp is always the string representation of the IP whether IPv4 or IPv6.

parameter.name: Mask
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceMask is in dotted string for IPv4 (for example, 255.255.0.0) or the number of bits in the mask for IPv4 and IPv6.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination IP address of the packet matches against this IP address. This is one of the configured IP addresses of the BroadWorks Server.

parameter.name: destinationPortFirst
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the first port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: destinationPortLast
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the last port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter determines the received network packet matches against this protocol. Values include: "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

context.name: StartupParam
context.description: Start-up parameter commands provide an administrative interface to manage Application Server start-up parameters, that is, parameters passed to the Application Server java process at start up. Examples of start-up parameters include activation of accounting events, e-mail protocol timeout values, and so on. NOTE: You must restart Application Server processes after adding or changing values so that configuration changes take effect.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view System Startup Parameters.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the system startup parameter to view.

command.name: set
command.description: System property-related attributes, such as the mail POP3 timeout or mail IMAP connection timeout, are changed using this command.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the system parameter to change.

parameter.name: bw.nameservice.cachePolicy
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Cache policy. When this parameter value is set to "HONOR_DNS", the Domain Name System (DNS) client uses the response's ''Time To Live'' (TTL) value.

parameter.name: bw.nameservice.denyTimeBoundedDuplicateLookups
parameter.description: This parameter controls the use of duplicate lookups with the same name and type from two time-bounded threads.

parameter.name: bw.nameservice.useAdditionalSrvRrs
parameter.description: This parameter controls the use of additional Resource Record (RR) sections of the Service Locator (SRV) lookup response. When the value is set to "true", it indicates that an A lookup resulting from SRV lookups uses the pre-resolved A resource records from the additional RR section of the SRV lookup response. Local caching must be enabled for this setting to have an effect.

parameter.name: dtdLocation
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the location of the Call Processing Language (CPL) Document Type Definition (DTD) file. The CPL DTD controls the syntax of the CPL scripts that are used on BroadWorks.

parameter.name: bw.sh.systemRefreshPublicIdentitiesPerHour
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the rate at which the Application Server refreshes public identities during a system refresh.

parameter.name: bw.sip.accessclustercontacthost
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value to populate the CONTACT host portion of Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) messages.

parameter.name: bw.nameservice.timeBoundedPoolSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads assigned to time-bounded Name Service queries.

parameter.name: bw.sip.accessclustercontactport
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port. This parameter must be set to "nil" to ensure that the access device does a Service Locator (SRV) record lookup on the contact host.

parameter.name: bw.ps.dms.numThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of Internet Protocol (IP) Device Configuration Management threads running on the Provisioning Server.

parameter.name: ps.bcct.nbworkerthreads
parameter.description: ERROR *** UNKNOWN PARAMETER ***

parameter.name: customerSoundFileDir
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the prefix of the path pointing to the place where customized ''.WAV'' files (for example, custom Auto Attendant greetings, custom user voice mail greetings, and personalized names) are stored. '''NOTE''': Changing this parameter may not have the expected result since uploading a custom ''.WAV'' file from the web does not take this property into account, nor does recording the ''.WAV'' files through the voice portal.

parameter.name: bw.diameter.xs.identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a server-specific Diameter identity associated with the Execution Server. This value is the same as the value of the Diameter identity associated with the Execution Server in the ''executionServerSubsystem/diameter''. This parameter is required when operating in relay mode.

parameter.name: bw.sh.numThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of threads for the Provisioning Server (at the application session level) to process Sh interface transactions.

parameter.name: publicIPAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the public Internet Protocol (IP) address of the Application Server. All access-side (toward access devices) traffic use this interface.

parameter.name: bw.diameter.ps.listeningAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address to which the Execution Server Diameter stack binds a server socket for incoming connections.

parameter.name: bw.nameservice.nCachePolicy
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the negative Cache policy. When this parameter value is set to "HONOR_DNS", the Domain Name System (DNS) client uses the minimum value of the response's Start of Authority (SOA) record.

parameter.name: org.apache.commons.logging.Log
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the address of the Apache logs channel that handles the integration of the Apache Commons Logging framework (a simple logging interface abstracting logging application programming interface [API]) with the BroadWorks logging framework. The log object points to an input channel. The name of the input channel is derived from the class name. Following are the six logging levels, in order from the least to the most serious: "trace", "debug", "info", "warn", "error", and "fatal".

parameter.name: bw.nameservice.unreachableServerLingerSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minimum time interval (in seconds) during which no Domain Name System (DNS) request is sent to a server that is detected as unreachable.

parameter.name: bw.diameter.ps.identity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Diameter identity associated with the Execution Server (included in the Origin-Host AVP of outgoing Diameter messages). '''NOTE''': The value cannot end with a period (.).

parameter.name: bw.nameservice.nCacheTtlSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time (in seconds) a looked-up record with a negative response is kept in the negative cache if the negative Cache policy is set to "Configured".

parameter.name: java.ldap.connect.timeout
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time-out (in seconds) for the connection from the Provisioning Server to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: bw.diameter.ps.maxPoolSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of Execution Server Diameter worker threads.

parameter.name: bw.nameservice.cacheTtlSecs
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time (in seconds) a successfully looked-up record is cached if the Cache policy is set to "Configured".

parameter.name: bw.ps.ocip.slowOCIPTransactionsNumThreads
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of slow Open Client Interface-Provisioning (OCI-P) transactions threads running on the Provisioning Server.

command.name: clear
command.description: System startup parameters are cleared (set to no value) using this command.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the system startup parameter to clear.

context.name: PSDiagnostic
context.description: This level is used to perform diagnostics tasks on the Profile Server.

context.name: Diag
context.description: This level is used to perform generic diagnostics tasks on the Profile Server.

command.name: dbNotif
command.description: This command is used to force database change notifications.

parameter.name: schema
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the schema.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the operation.

parameter.name: resync
parameter.description: This parameter forces a refresh of all keys for the recovery of the database connection.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.description: This parameter executes a database change notification for an unspecified operation on a key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the key. It is typically the name of the database table.

parameter.name: insert
parameter.description: This parameter executes a database change notification for an insertion.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the key. It is typically the name of the database table.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a hint. It is typically the unique index value of the row.

parameter.name: update
parameter.description: This parameter executes a database change notification for an update.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the key. It is typically the name of the database table.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a hint. It is typically the unique index value of the row.

parameter.name: delete
parameter.description: This parameter executes a database change notification for a deletion.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the key. It is typically the name of the database table.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a hint. It is typically the unique index value of the row.

command.name: heap
command.description: This command is used to view data associated with the JAVA heap.

parameter.name: mainOption
parameter.description: This parameter specifies how much information is shown.
